intro: Trochetia thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its slow growth and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in its native habitat.
